list.title: gRPC
list.description: I like gRPC transport mechanism for request/response as non-persistent streaming protocol.

list.title: Google Cloud Pub/Sub
list.description: GC Pub/Sub became my favt tool for event driven architecture and a good alternative to Kafka as it is backed by Google and because of it's less complexity

list.title: Socket.IO
list.description: I am using Socket.IO for bi-directional communication for quite a long now.

list.title: FCM
list.description: Using Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM) since 2019, as it's powered by Google, feels pretty consistant and reliable.

list.title: Docker
list.description: Everyday's tool. In fact if I create a new repo now, I put it on docker first.

list.title: Jest
list.description: Previously I was using Jasmine for testing. Now using Jest since 2019.

list.title: Jasmine
list.description: Before I started to use Jest, I was using Jesmine continuously as a testing framework for JavaScript

list.title: Redux
list.description: If I use React or React Native apps, redux will take place there for sure.

list.title: Redux Saga
list.description: I use it to handle side effects of react or, react-native apps.

list.title: Sass
list.description: Whenever I say I am writting CSS, it means I am writting Sass. I mean literally

list.title: Gulp
list.description: I use gulp mostly when I don't use a framework. Great tool as a task-runner

list.title: Git
list.description: Of course you can say, "Every minute I use Git on GitHub and GitLab". Literally.

list.title: ORM / ODM
list.description: I use Mongoose, Sequelize & TypeORM to deal with the databases I work on day-to-day.

list.title: Redis
list.description: I've been using Redis for caching & scheduling. I love it for those purposes.

list.title: Databases
list.description: So far I've worked with Postgres, MongoDB & MySQL.

list.title: Firebase
list.description: I love this platform. I feel so comfortable and confident as it's backed by Google

list.title: SonarQube
list.description: I use Sonar to inspect my code quality, detect bugs, code smells and security vulnerabilities. Really helps when I work in a team.

list.title: HashiCorp Vault
list.description: It's a single source of truth to manage credentials. I use it for storing application API keys, passwords, certificates and other sensitive data.

list.title: Doppler
list.description: Doppler is the easiest way to securely manage all your environment variables in one encrypted place. No more sharing secrets over Slack or copying .env.

list.title: Selenium
list.description: I use it to automate browser related stuffs as well as to write e2e test.

list.title: GitHub Actions
list.description: GitHub Actions is a continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) platform that allows you to automate your build, test, and deployment pipeline.

list.title: DigitalOcean
list.description: DigitalOcean is a cloud computing vendor that offers an Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) platform for software developers.
